page.title: 07HEALTH CARE
page.content: The Doctors Practice is situated in Bilsthorpe with 2 doctors in attendance and 3 receptionists. An Ante-Natal Clinic takes place at the surgery. Eakring patients reach the surgery by bus or car, special days are Mondays and Thursday. The doctors attend people at home who are not able to go to the surgery. The Nurses who come to the district are based at Rainworth Health Centre, they comprise of a District Nurse who has the help of a Bath Nurse, a District Midwife who attends Ante-Natal and Post-Natal women, most women have their babies in hospital but if they are alright some come home after 6 hours, the majority however stay 24-48 hours. The Midwife attends a mother and baby for 10 days then the Health Visitor starts visiting and runs the Child Clinic in the Library once a week.
